short_description: SQL/MR function for combining URI components into a single encoded URI.
long_description: URIPACK can reassemble URI split into their constituent parks using URIUNPACK. Values included in the columns in the argument QUERIES are converted to a query string of the form '?query1=value1&query2=value2'. If the optional arguments SCHEME_COLUMN, HOST_COLUMN, PATH_COLUMN, and FRAGMENT_COLUMN are included, the output URI will be of the form 'scheme://host/path?querystring#fragment'.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the URIs to be packed.
input_tables.description: The table containing the URIs to be packed.

argument_clauses.name: Queries
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the query parameters whose values are to be included in the URIs
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the query parameters whose values are to be included in the URIs

argument_clauses.name: SchemeColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI scheme.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI scheme.

argument_clauses.name: HostColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI host.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI host.

argument_clauses.name: PathColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI path.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI path.

argument_clauses.name: FragmentColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI fragment.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the URI fragment.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: IgnoreValues
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a list of (case-insensitive) strings for the function to treat as null values. If you omit this argument, the function treats only the string 'null' as a null value. If you specify this argument, you must specify the string 'null' to have the function treat it as a null value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a list of (case-insensitive) strings for the function to treat as null values. If you omit this argument, the function treats only the string 'null' as a null value. If you specify this argument, you must specify the string 'null' to have the function treat it as a null value.
